alert.note: Alert for Cheshire; Merrimack; Northern Coos; Northern Grafton; Southern Coos; Southern Grafton; Sullivan; Western And Central Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 10 at 12:04PM EDT until July 12 at 6:20AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central, northern, and southern New Hampshire, including the following areas, in New Hampshire, Western And Central Hillsborough. In central New Hampshire, Merrimack and Sullivan. In northern New Hampshire, Northern Coos, Northern Grafton, Southern Coos and Southern Grafton. In southern New Hampshire, Cheshire. * WHEN...Through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Although rain has lightened somewhat this morning, another round of heavy rain and thunderstorms is expected this afternoon and could lead to new flash flooding, o0r a resurgence in flooding in those areas that have already flooded. Also, river flooding is possible as rivers crest tonight or early Tuesday.
info.instruction: You should monitor the latest forecast and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Cheshire; Merrimack; Northern Coos; Northern Grafton; Southern Coos; Southern Grafton; Sullivan; Western And Central Hillsborough
